intro: Stanhopea bucephalus var. roezlii, commonly known as the Rösel's stanhopea, is a rare and striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. This variant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically display a combination of yellow and pink hues with intricate patterns. It thrives in high humidity and cool temperatures, often growing on trees or in shaded, moist environments. The plant has a pseudobulb structure that stores water and nutrients, aiding its survival in its natural habitat. Due to its rarity and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
